class forum.forms.CreateInDiscussion(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)[source]

Bases: ModelForm

Form that pulls in the Discussion model and excludes the user field in the Meta class.

Parameters:

ModelForm – Django form that is used to create a form from a model.

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

Defines the model and excludes the user field.

Parameters:

  • model – Uses the Discussion model from models.py in the forum app.

  • exclude – Excludes the user field from the form.

forum.models module

class forum.models.Discussion(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

The Discussion model encapsulates data for the discussion within the forum. Discussions will remain even if users are deleted, for archival purposes.

Parameters:

  • models.Model – Django model that is used to create a model from a database.

  • user – Defines the field parameters for the user, which is a ForeignKey relationship with the Django User model.

  • forum – Defines the field parameters for the forum, which is a ForeignKey relationship with the Forum model.

  • discuss – Defines the field parameters for the discuss, which is a CharField with a maximum length of 1000 characters.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

discuss

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

forum

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

forum_id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id
class forum.models.Forum(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

The Forum model encapsulates the data for the forum. Forum topics will remain even if users are deleted, for archival purposes.

Parameters:

  • models.Model – Django model that is used to create a model from a database.

  • user – Defines the field parameters for the user, which is a ForeignKey relationship with the Django User model.

  • topic – Defines the field parameters for the topic, which is a CharField with a maximum length of 300 characters.

  • description – Defines the field parameters for the description, which is a CharField with a maximum length of 1000 characters.

  • date_created – Defines the field parameters for the date_created, which is a DateTimeField that is automatically set when a new forum topic is created.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

date_created

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

description

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

discussion_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
topic

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id

forum.urls module

forum.urls.app_name = 'disc_forum'

App name for the forum app. Used for easy referencing in templates.

forum.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern '' [name='forum_page']>, <URLPattern 'addInForum/' [name='addInForum']>, <URLPattern 'addInDiscussion/' [name='addInDiscussion']>]

URLs for the forum app. The first path is the main forum page. The second path is for adding a new forum topic. The third path is for adding a new discussion/comment.

forum.views module

forum.views.addInDiscussion(request)[source]

Restricted view to add a discussion to a forum topic, using the CreateInDiscussion form and rendered in the addInDiscussion.html template.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object sent to the server.

  • form – The CreateInDiscussion form pulled from forms.py. The form request method is checked and form is saved if valid.

  • discussion_instance – The instance of the discussion object that is created.

  • context – The context dictionary to be rendered in the template.

Returns:

The addInDiscussion.html template with the context.

forum.views.addInForum(request)[source]

Restricted view to add a forum topic, using the CreateInForum form and rendered in the addInForum.html template.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object sent to the server.

  • form – The CreateInForum form pulled from forms.py. Form request method is checked and form is saved if valid.

  • forum_instance – The instance of the forum object created.

  • context – The context dictionary to be rendered in the template.

Returns:

The addInForum.html template with the context.

forum.views.forum_page(request)[source]

Collects FORUM and related DISCUSSION object data and renders it to the forum_page.html template.

Parameters:

  • request – The request object sent to the server.

  • forums – Grabs all the Forum objects in the database.

  • count – Counts the number of Forum objects.

  • discussions – Initial empty list to store all the Discussion objects sitting in each Forum object.

Returns:

The forum_page.html template with the context.
